realising is the 1st step wanting to change the 2nd step you already achieved so much and the most important step aa is a good suggestion its important to have shared experience and nonjudgmental support keeping yourself busy is a good idea but also change some behaviour like social event timing of meeting friend how late where and what friend make sure alcohol doesnt come back into your life personally i have learnt to live with the perceived shame of saying no to alcohol asking for soft drink even if i feel it make me look like girly i dont care any more but at the beginning there wa a bit of shame and surprise from others thats insidious criticism for the behaviour of not having alcohol you can find excuse i already had some before etc but just get used to sticking to the same story you dont drink anymore final stop no alcohol no excuse no celebration celebrate with a virgin mojito whatever fancy soft cocktail just no alcohol i dont know whether you want to try very lowalcohol beer they dont taste a good but you get used to it it ha a tiny little bit alcohol though physical and mental activity are great not just to keep yourself busy but to invest yourself into a passion you find worthwhile not just for your daughter but for yourself for the long term who do you want to become in 2 year 10 year from now having a physical or mental activity at the time you typically had alcohol would benefit by  keeping you away from the people and place where you consumed no exposure i dont go out to the bar with my colleague anymore or only at lunch in a restaurant when work is an excuse to not consume alcohol  you need your full yourself capacity to do those mental or physical activity so you just cant allow yourself to drink for example running gym or music or work on shift i couldnt drink at night anymore because i had to deliver important work task alcohol wa making me achieve poorly well done to you and keep courage
identify your trigger and stay away from them take up a hobby and go allin im proud of you dude this is a milestone
go see a doctor before quitting withdrawal can cause seizure and such

i also used to have a problem cutting off completely felt very hard something that probably every drunk will say p but i learned some thing along the way that helped me a lot i am not completely sober but rather at a point where im happy and in control here are some tip that worked for me dont have any strong alcohol in the house ever i had the idea that being able to mix drink wa a cool thing for a man in his late twenty to do so i used to buy a lot of booze this only resulted in me drinking whiskey a it wa and in the middle of the week when i decided to change my life i just poured everything out in the sink havent bought a single bottle of strong alcohol since that wa 67 year ago limit beer to non or low alcoholic this helped me from being soused and vomiting once a week to occasionally drinking a beer to relax on a friday two small bud lights with a bag of chip and a movie is my exact level take up a new interest where you need to be cataloging and planning a bit maybe start collecting something inexpensive that requires making small trip to thrift shop i collect lps and catalog them on discogs horror movie imdb is my second most frequent page and antique trinket to decorate my apartment and find that rummaging through dusty ol pawn shop and yard sale can take up an entire saturday but leave me feeling fulfilled instead of just drinking away in front of the tv at night i listen to my new album and move around plant and painting trying to optimize my living space start drinking weird soda root beer juice and other non alcoholic stuff ive found that i get a big enjoyment out of savoring artisanal nonalcoholic drink some crazy imported hawaiian root beer with a fun label can be just a satisfying a it alcoholic equivalent avoid or adjust situation where you risk getting hammered i used to run a podcast with two other day drinker and we almost always recorded and drank after lunch on saturdays when we ended the podcast i realized that i dont need to be drunk to hang out with my friend i dont mean that you should heavily limit your life or cut people off but at least identify and be aware of situation that might make you fall back and avoid or change them to benefit your situation in my case i probably should have scheduled the podcast earlier in the day and made sure not to bring anything to drink other than soda maybe i could have planned activity after the podcast that forced me to be sober dont be too hard on yourself and remember that youre only human

just did on your own thats impressive i mean that both my bf and i had to be dragged kicking and screaming to get there you identified a problem and had enough emotional maturity to call yourself out a an aa person or whatever step 3 is working on that the rest just kinda work itself out so youll be aaight youre almost halfway there  edit just to be clear im not antiaa people get defensive about
